SEARCH
Package controller

Class FlightController

java.lang.Object
controller.FlightController
public class FlightController extends Object
Controller class for managing flight operations in the airport management system.

This class serves as the specialized controller for flight-related operations within the airport management system. It maintains the current flight session state, manages flight search results, and provides comprehensive methods for accessing flight information, passenger details, and flight management operations.

The FlightController is responsible for:

  • Managing the currently selected flight session information
  • Handling flight search results and associated metadata
  • Providing access to flight details, schedules, and capacity information
  • Managing passenger information within flight contexts
  • Coordinating flight operations such as check-in, status updates, and delay management
  • Supporting both arriving and departing flight types with specialized handling
Since:
1.0
See Also:
  • Flight
  • Arriving

  • Method Details

    • searchFlightCustomer

      public void searchFlightCustomer(String departingCity, String arrivingCity, LocalDate initialDate, LocalDate finalDate, LocalTime initialTime, LocalTime finalTime, List<String> ids, List<String> companyNames, List<Date> dates, List<Time> departureTimes, List<Time> arrivalTimes, List<Integer> delays, List<String> status, List<Integer> maxSeats, List<Integer> freeSeats, List<String> cities, JButton searchButton)
      Performs comprehensive flight search operations for customer flight selection.

      This method executes a flight search operation using multiple filtering criteria to find flights matching customer requirements. It interfaces with the database through FlightDAOImpl to retrieve flight information and processes the results to create appropriate flight objects for customer selection.

      The search supports flexible filtering criteria, including:

      • Departure city - flights leaving from a specific location
      • Arrival city - flights going to a specific destination
      • Date range - flights within specified date boundaries
      • Time range - flights departing within specific time windows
      Parameters:
      departingCity - the departure city name for filtering (null for no filter)
      arrivingCity - the arrival city name for filtering (null for no filter)
      initialDate - the start date for date range filtering (null for no filter)
      finalDate - the end date for date range filtering (null for no filter)
      initialTime - the start time for time range filtering (null for no filter)
      finalTime - the end time for time range filtering (null for no filter)
      ids - list to be populated with flight identifiers from search results
      companyNames - list to be populated with airline company names
      dates - list to be populated with flight dates
      departureTimes - list to be populated with departure times
      arrivalTimes - list to be populated with arrival times
      delays - list to be populated with flight delay information
      status - list to be populated with flight status values
      maxSeats - list to be populated with maximum seat capacities
      freeSeats - list to be populated with available seat counts
      cities - list to be populated with destination or origin city names
      searchButton - the button component to use as reference for error message display

    • startCheckin

      public int startCheckin()
      Initiates the check-in process for the currently active flight.

      This method attempts to start the check-in procedure for the current flight by interfacing with the database through FlightDAOImpl. The check-in process typically involves status validation, timing verification, and system preparation for passenger check-in operations.

      Returns:
      status code indicating check-in initiation success (positive values) or failure (negative values)

    • setCheckins

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<String>> setCheckins(ArrayList<PassengerPanel> truePassengers, ArrayList<PassengerPanel> falsePassengers)
      Processes passenger check-in status updates and returns luggage check-in information.

      This method handles bulk check-in status updates for passengers, processing two collections of passenger panels representing those who should be checked in and those who should not be checked in. It coordinates with the database to update check-in statuses and retrieves associated luggage check-in information.

      Parameters:
      truePassengers - collection of PassengerPanel objects representing passengers to be checked in
      falsePassengers - collection of PassengerPanel objects representing passengers not to be checked in
      Returns:
      nested list structure containing luggage check-in information for processed passengers

    • getFlightType

      public boolean getFlightType(int index)
      Determines if a flight in the search results is a departing flight.
      Parameters:
      index - the zero-based index of the flight in the search results
      Returns:
      true if the flight at the specified index is a departing flight, false if it is an arriving flight

    • getBookingResultSelectedFlightFlightType

      public boolean getBookingResultSelectedFlightFlightType(String flightId)

      Parameters:
      flightId - the unique identifier of the flight to check type for
      Returns:
      true if the flight with the specified ID is a departing flight, false if it is an arriving flight or not found

    • addFlight

      public boolean addFlight(String flightId, String companyName, LocalDate flightDate, LocalTime departureTime, LocalTime arrivalTime, int maxSeats, String otherCity, boolean flightType, JButton confirmButton)
      Creates and adds a new flight to the airport management system.

      This method processes the creation of a new flight by handling scheduling information, calculating appropriate timestamps, and interfacing with the database through FlightDAOImpl to persist the flight data. It supports both arriving and departing flight types based on the flightType parameter.

      Parameters:
      flightId - unique identifier for the new flight
      companyName - airline company name operating the flight
      flightDate - scheduled flight date
      departureTime - scheduled departure time
      arrivalTime - scheduled arrival time (may be next day for overnight flights)
      maxSeats - maximum passenger capacity for the flight
      otherCity - destination city for departing flights, origin city for arriving flights
      flightType - true for departing flights, false for arriving flights
      confirmButton - UI button reference for error message display
      Returns:
      true if flight creation was successful, false if database errors occurred

    • setFlightStatus

      public int setFlightStatus(Object flightStatus)
      Updates the operational status of the currently active flight in the database.
      Parameters:
      flightStatus - the new flight status as an Object (typically String) to be set
      Returns:
      integer status code indicating operation success or failure

    • addDelay

      public int addDelay(int delay) throws NumberFormatException
      Adds delay information to the currently active flight.

      This method updates the delay information for the current flight by interfacing with the database through FlightDAOImpl. It includes validation to ensure that delay values are non-negative, throwing a NumberFormatException for invalid input values.

      Parameters:
      delay - the delay amount in minutes to add to the flight (must be non-negative)
      Returns:
      integer status code indicating operation success or failure
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the delay value is negative

    • getImminentArrivingFlights

      public Object[][] getImminentArrivingFlights()
      Retrieves imminent arriving flight information for display purposes.

      This method queries the database for flights that are scheduled to arrive in the near future and formats the information into a two-dimensional array suitable for table display in user interfaces. It specifically handles arriving flights with comprehensive information including delays and gate assignments.

      The method performs several operations:

      • Database query through FlightDAOImpl for imminent arrivals
      • Flight object creation with complete operational information
      • Data formatting for GUI table display with localized status translation
      • Delay calculation and time adjustment for accurate arrival predictions
      • Gate information formatting with "N/A" fallback for unassigned gates
      Returns:
      two-dimensional Object array containing formatted arriving flight information, or empty array if database errors occur

    • getImminentDepartingFlights

      public Object[][] getImminentDepartingFlights()
      Retrieves imminent departing flight information for display purposes.

      This method queries the database for flights that are scheduled to depart in the near future and formats the information into a two-dimensional array suitable for table display in user interfaces. It specifically handles departing flights with comprehensive information including delays and gate assignments.

      The method performs operations similar to imminent arrivals but focuses on departing flight characteristics:

      • Database query through FlightDAOImpl for imminent departures
      • Flight object creation using arriving flight objects for data consistency
      • Route formatting showing "Napoli -> destination" for departure context
      • Departure time adjustment based on delay information
      • Status translation and gate assignment formatting
      Returns:
      two-dimensional Object array containing formatted departing flight information, or empty array if database errors occur
